intro: Nicipe hesperantha, commonly known as the western nitcha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
